instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Vcore Present, CPU Warm, No Chime
threads.message: Hello all! Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board here that has all power rails, CPU gets warm, but no chime. Suspecting maybe BIOS IS BAD, however every link I found here on the forum are broken. Could anyone pls send me a known working file?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Vcore Present, CPU Warm, No Chime
threads.message:
I posted some BIOS links for 00165 a week ago.
Did you check them?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-not-booting-after-big-sur-upgrade.61298/[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Vcore Present, CPU Warm, No Chime
threads.message: Thanks for replying! Tried both and I have same result. Fan spins at max, no chime, VCORE stable at 1,8V. Any ideas? I suspect bad PCH.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Vcore Present, CPU Warm, No Chime
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
Any history fault available?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
Also check series resistors from LPC bus.
